H0.text: Auxin causes cells to divide when cytokinins are added to it.

H1.text: Osmosis causes cells to divide when cytokinins are added to them.

H2.text: Apoptosis is what causes cells to divide when cytokinins are added to them.

H3.text: Hyptoxin causes cells to divide when cytokinins are added to it.

A4.text: When cytokinin and auxin are both added together, the cells expand and differentiate.

A5.text: Auxin from apical buds travels down shoots to inhibit axillary bud growth.

A7.text: Auxin also stimulates cell division if cytokinins are present.

A8.text: Both hormones are key to cell cycle regulation, but when they come together, their synergistic interactions can enhance cell proliferation and organogenesis more effectively than either could in isolation.
